title: Natural Logarithm Antiderivatives
text: Let $$f(x)=\ln(|x|)$$. for $$x>0$$, $$f(x)=ln(x)$$ and $$\frac{d}{dx} lnx=\frac{1}{x}$$. For $$x<0$$, $$f(x)=ln(-x)$$ and $$\frac{d}{dx} \operatorname{lnnegneg}\left(x\right)=\frac{-1}{-x}=\frac{1}{x}$$.

title: Adding Constants
text: Make sure to add "+C" after your intial antiderivative to account for the unknown constant.
